doc.field: Correspondence addressed to Thomas S. Mount in Brooklyn and Stony Brook, N.Y. during the period 1871 to 1890. Letters are mostly from publishers of various Long Island newspapers, including the Long Island Reporter, the Long Islander, the Port Jefferson Times and Leader, the Sag Harbor Express, and the South Side Signal, regarding business and financial matters and the publication of advertisements and articles submitted by Mount. Various receipts reflecting Mount's dealings with the newspapers are also included.

Thomas S. Mount (d. 1900) was a lawyer, politician, and scholar and a resident of Suffolk County, Long Island.
The source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.
